# Tender Announcement

## Title
Superconducting Nanowire Single Photon Detector System

## Reference and Solicitation Numbers
Reference Number: cb-94-97658613
Solicitation Number: 23-58160

## Tender Details
Tender Closing Date: November 22, 2023, 2:00 PM EST
Expected Contract Start Date: August 2024
Expected Contract End Date: May 2025

## Physics World Act Addresses
The National Research Council has a requirement for a low timing jitter Superconducting Nanowire Single Photon Detector (SNSPD) system containing at least 22 detectors, which must exhibit high quantum efficiency (>80%), high count rates (>5 MHz), and low dark counts (<100 Hz).

## Contracting Entity
National Research Council Canada
1200 Montreal Road, Ottawa, ON K1A 0R6, Canada
Contact: Paul Hewitt, (343) 573-1068
Email: Paul.Hewitt@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca

## Statement of Capabilities

Suppliers are invited to submit a statement of capabilities to demonstrate their capability to meet the advertised requirements. The statement must clearly outline the supplier's ability to provide the SNSPD system.

## Notice Details

* Notice Type: Advance Contract Award Notice
* Procurement Method: Advance contract award notice
* Trade Agreements: All trade agreements listed in section 7 below
* Tender Status: Expired

## Exclusions and Exceptions

Exceptions under subsection 6(d) of the Government Contracts Regulations are invoked due to the absence of competition for technical reasons.

## Tender Exclusions

The following exclusions and/or limited tendering reasons apply:

* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) - Article 513(1)(b)(iii): Due to the absence of competition for technical reasons.
* World Trade Organization - Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP) - Article XIII(b)(iii): Due to the absence of competition for technical reasons.
* China-Canada Agreement - Article 18.5(1)(b)(iii): Due to the absence of competition for technical reasons.
* ... (list all trade agreements).

## Ownership and Intellectual Property

The Crown will have the right to use the SNSPD system for normal business operations once purchased. The design and intellectual property of the system belong to the contractor.
